org.anarres.dhcp.v6.service

Interface Dhcp6LeaseManager

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractDhcp6LeaseManager, PooledDhcp6LeaseManager

    @Beta
public interface Dhcp6LeaseManager
    A delegate handler for LeaseManagerDhcp6Service. Responsible for leasing IPs and providing additional information to clients https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3315#section-18.2

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Dhcp6Message confirm(Dhcp6RequestContext requestContext, Dhcp6Message incomingMsg, Dhcp6Message reply)
      Lease manager needs to add a status code to the reply Success/NotOnLink.
      Dhcp6Message decline(Dhcp6RequestContext requestContext, Dhcp6Message incomingMsg, Dhcp6Message reply)
      Handle declined IPs by a client.
      Dhcp6Message handle(Dhcp6RequestContext requestContext, Dhcp6Message incomingMsg)
      Handle unknown/undefined message.
      Dhcp6Message lease(Dhcp6RequestContext requestContext, Dhcp6Message incomingMsg, Dhcp6Message reply)
      Lease manager can decide whether to serve a specific request or not
      Dhcp6Message rebind(Dhcp6RequestContext requestContext, Dhcp6Message incomingMsg, Dhcp6Message reply)
      Rebind the addresses leased to client.
      Dhcp6Message release(Dhcp6RequestContext requestContext, Dhcp6Message incomingMsg, Dhcp6Message reply)
      Release all leased addresses from incomingMsg
      Dhcp6Message renew(Dhcp6RequestContext requestContext, Dhcp6Message incomingMsg, Dhcp6Message reply)
      Renew the addresses leased to client.
      Dhcp6Message requestInformation(Dhcp6RequestContext requestContext, Dhcp6Message incomingMsg, Dhcp6Message reply)
      Provide additional information (options) to the client.

      • lease

        @Nullable
Dhcp6Message lease(Dhcp6RequestContext requestContext,
                             Dhcp6Message incomingMsg,
                             Dhcp6Message reply)
                      throws Dhcp6Exception
        Lease manager can decide whether to serve a specific request or not
        Throws:
        Dhcp6Exception

      • release

        @Nonnull
Dhcp6Message release(Dhcp6RequestContext requestContext,
                              Dhcp6Message incomingMsg,
                              Dhcp6Message reply)
                       throws Dhcp6Exception
        Release all leased addresses from incomingMsg
        Throws:
        Dhcp6Exception

      • requestInformation

        @Nonnull
Dhcp6Message requestInformation(Dhcp6RequestContext requestContext,
                                         Dhcp6Message incomingMsg,
                                         Dhcp6Message reply)
                                  throws Dhcp6Exception
        Provide additional information (options) to the client. This is called as a separate request, but also during: lease, rebind, renew
        Throws:
        Dhcp6Exception

      • confirm

        @Nullable
Dhcp6Message confirm(Dhcp6RequestContext requestContext,
                               Dhcp6Message incomingMsg,
                               Dhcp6Message reply)
                        throws Dhcp6Exception
        Lease manager needs to add a status code to the reply Success/NotOnLink. If there is not enough information to confirm the request. Lease manager should return null.
        Throws:
        Dhcp6Exception

      • renew

        @Nonnull
Dhcp6Message renew(Dhcp6RequestContext requestContext,
                            Dhcp6Message incomingMsg,
                            Dhcp6Message reply)
                     throws Dhcp6Exception
        Renew the addresses leased to client. This should be called from the client at time T1.
        Throws:
        Dhcp6Exception

      • rebind

        @Nullable
Dhcp6Message rebind(Dhcp6RequestContext requestContext,
                              Dhcp6Message incomingMsg,
                              Dhcp6Message reply)
                       throws Dhcp6Exception
        Rebind the addresses leased to client. This should be called from the client at time T2.
        Throws:
        Dhcp6Exception

      • decline

        @Nonnull
Dhcp6Message decline(Dhcp6RequestContext requestContext,
                              Dhcp6Message incomingMsg,
                              Dhcp6Message reply)
                       throws Dhcp6Exception
        Handle declined IPs by a client. IPs are probably already in use and should not be leased.
        Throws:
        Dhcp6Exception

      • handle

        @Nullable
Dhcp6Message handle(Dhcp6RequestContext requestContext,
                              Dhcp6Message incomingMsg)
                       throws Dhcp6Exception
        Handle unknown/undefined message. If a DHCPv6 message does not fall into any of the above methods, this one will be invoked. The implementations of LeaseManager might support additional DHCPv6 message types.
        Throws:
        Dhcp6Exception
